pkgmetadata.longdescription: An Alternative to the Kruskal-Wallis Based on the Kendall Tau Distance // The Concordance Test is a non-parametric method for testing whether two o more samples originate from the same distribution. It extends the Kendall Tau correlation coefficient when there are only two groups. For details, see Alcaraz J., Anton-Sanchez L., Monge J.F. (2022) The Concordance Test, an Alternative to Kruskal-Wallis Based on the Kendall-tau Distance: An R Package. The R Journal 14, 2653 doi:10.32614/RJ-2022-039.
